alert.note: Alert for Natrona; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 23 at 2:00PM MDT until June 23 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Natrona County in central Wyoming... Southeastern Washakie County in central Wyoming... * Until 215 PM MDT. * At 200 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage were located 15 miles east of Cottonwood Pass, which is also 36 miles southwest of Kaycee, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Natrona and southeastern Washakie Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
